New Records: Australia maintained a perfect record in the 2026 World Cup qualifiers with a 2-0 win over Bangladesh
Key Match Events: Bangladesh scored an own goal in the 29th minute
Kusini Yengi scored the second goal for Australia in the 62nd minute
Nestory Irankunda made his debut for the Socceroos
Pre-Game Insights: Australia were expected to dominate due to their higher FIFA ranking
Bangladesh had not performed well in previous matches against Australia
The match was played in challenging conditions with high humidity
Post-Match Reflections: Graham Arnold praised the team's performance despite the tough conditions
Australia's perfect record in the qualifiers was maintained
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was in poor condition due to the weather
The match was the Socceroos' fifth consecutive win in the qualifiers
Others: The match was the first appearance of Nestory Irankunda for the Socceroos
